desc: CCNE1 encodes Cyclin E1, a positive regulator of cell cycle progression. Amplification or overexpression of CCNE1 is found in a diverse range of cancers.

The CCNE1 gene encodes Cyclin E1, a regulator of the cell cycle that activates the cyclin-dependent kinase, CDK2, during the G1/S transition in the cell cycle (PMID: 1833068, 1833066). High expression of Cyclin E1 is restricted to cells undergoing the G1/S transition due to transcriptional and post-transcriptional regulation of CCNE1/Cyclin E1 (PMID: 1388288, 15838514, 22186781, 24605326). The Cyclin E1-CDK2 complex phosphorylates p27(Kip1) and p21 which signal for the degradation of Cyclin D and promotes the expression of Cyclin A, leading to progression through S phase (PMID: 8978686, 9192873). Cyclin E1-CDK2 phosphorylates and inactivates retinoblastoma protein (RB) thus releasing the RB-mediated sequestration of the transcription factor E2F and allowing for activation of E2F-regulated cell cycle genes (PMID: 1388095, 1828392, 7623816). Degradation of Cyclin E1 is also highly regulated; Cyclin E1-CDK2 is degraded by SCF-Fbw7 (an E3 ligase that is commonly mutated in cancer). Insufficient degradation of Cyclin E1 by SCF-Fbw7 can lead to genomic instability and aberrant cell proliferation (PMID: 10611969, 11533444, 14536078, 11565033). Increased Cyclin E expression in cell lines leads to quicker passage through the G1/S phase, but deletion of Cyclin E or CDK2 in mice does not result in a G1/S defect (PMID: 8384376, 12941272, 12970191). Cyclin E knockout mice have a defect in cell cycle entry after quiescence (PMID: 12941272, 12970191). Cyclin E-CDK2 phosphorylates p220 (NPAT) to activate histone transcription (PMID: 10995387), p300/CBP (PMID: 10783242) and Smad3 (PMID: 21150326). Cyclin E also phosphorylates centrosomal proteins (PMID: 15514162), has a role in loading MCM to replication origins (PMID: 10806104) and regulates apoptosis via phosphorylation of FOXO1 (PMID: 12913110). Overexpression of Cyclin E1 has been implicated in many cancers and can be indicative of poor prognosis (PMID: 22186781).
